text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT SALE - The Taiwan Flour Mills Association bought two shipments totalling 60,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat at a tender on Friday. Cargill, Marubeni, Mitsui and Itochu each sold parts of the shipment, traders said. The shipments contain Dark Northern Spring (DNS), Hard Red Winter (HRW) and White Wheat (WW). The first shipment's freight was fixed at US$19.40 per tonneand the second at US$20.40 per tonne -- both for delivery from the Pacific Northwest.

WHEAT SALE - Philippine flour mills bought 40,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat from Japanese trading firm Mitsubishi Corp, traders said. Traders said the flour mills bought 19,040 tonnes of western white wheat at $167 to $168 per tonne, 16,000 tonnes of dark northern spring wheat with a 13.5 percent protein content at $188 per tonne, and 4,960 tonnes of dark northern spring wheat with a 14 percent protein content at $192.5 to $193 per tonne.

WHEAT TENDER - Two Philippine flour mills plan to buy 28,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for November delivery, traders said. "One firm invited us to give price quotes for 7,000 tonnes dark northern spring wheat with 14 percent protein content, 2,000 (tonnes) dark northern spring wheat with a 13.5 percent protein content and 3,000 tonnes western white wheat," said one trader at an American commodity house. The Philippine flour mill will open the bids on Monday, the trader said.

WHEAT TENDER - Algeria passed up offers in its import tender for 100,000 tonnes of US and/or Canadian durum wheat because prices offered were too high, European grain traders said. There was, however, no official confirmation Algeria had passed on the tender. Traders did not know if Algeria planned to place another tender for the wheat soon. Algeria was seeking to import 50,000 tonnes of durum wheat for shipment in the first half of December and another 50,000 tonnes for shipment in the second half of December.

WHEAT TENDER - Jordan announced a snap tender to buy 150,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat which is to be delivered in three lots of 50,000 tonnes each in November, December and January. October 15 was set for bid deadline.

- The CCC said it is retendering for up to 35,000 tonnes U.S. No.2 or better hard red winter, soft white or soft red winter wheat for donation to Eritrea. Shipment was slated for Oct 30-Nov 25. Offers must be due by October 15.
- Sri Lanka is to seek October 18 100,000 tonnes optional-origin wheat for Nov 11-20 shipment.

WHEAT TENDER cont'd - Armenia will be seeking 21,000 tonnes optional origin wheat for up to November 20 shipment, its U.S. export agent said. The wheat would come from the European Community, Ukraine or if U.S. origin, only hard red winter no.2. The date for offers was Oct 14, Yerevan, Armenia.

- The Cyprus Grain Commission invited tenders for a combined cargo of 12,000 tonnes of U.S. or Canadian spring wheat and 6,000 tonnes of U.S. or Canadian durum wheat. The tender closes October 15 and shipment is November 15-30.
